snippet: After a shoplifting suspect fled custody, becoming at least the fourth person to escape from the police this summer, Commissioner William J. Bratton said he would not tolerate such carelessness.
abstract: Tiffany Neumann becomes fourth person in New York City to escape from police custody since June; was able to slip past guard while being held at New York-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital; police officials say escapes are particularly disconcerting following prominent upstate prison break earlier in summer.
lead_paragraph: After a shoplifting suspect fled custody, becoming at least the fourth person to escape from the police this summer, Commissioner William J. Bratton said he would not tolerate such carelessness.

headline.main: Top Officials With New York City Police Are Angered by Escapes
headline.print_headline: Top Police Officials Are Angered by Escapes
